version_description:
+ Fixed a bug that was causing Applet data update issues
+ Fixed a bug that caused some Applets to go missing from My Applets — and a bug where deleted Applets wouldn't get the heck out of My Applets immediately
+ Fixed a bug where Widgets woul

+ Some small bugs interrupted our trick-or-treating, so we fixed them. Joke's on you, bugs — we're adults and can just buy candy any time we feel like it!
+ While you're here, check out some of our newer services: Air by Propeller, Asana, CNCT Life, Re

+ Give a warm welcome to your Account Settings, now available in the app. Manage communication subscriptions, your username, password, and more. Look for "Account" in settings.

+ We made a much needed improvement to Applet creation: you can change

+ We made improvements to the iOS Reminders and Reading List services. If you use Applets that back up your reminders, open your IFTTT app to sync up before you update, just to make sure you capture all your reminders! The services will work normally foll

+ We made improvements to the iOS Reminders and Reading List services. If you use Applets that back up your reminders, open your IFTTT app to sync up before you update, just to make sure you capture all your reminders! The services will work normally foll

+ Headsup, this will be the last version of the IFTTT app to support iOS 9. Please update your device's software to keep getting app updates!

+ We added some under-the-hood improvements to reliability, as well as fixed some crashes that users with

+ Headsup, this will be the last version of the IFTTT app to support iOS 9. Please update your device's software to keep getting app updates!

+ We added some under-the-hood improvements to reliability, as well as fixed some crashes that users with

+ Nothing to see here... jk jk.

+ This update includes stability improvements as well as support for an upcoming feature.

+ Also, newly published on IFTTT since the last update: TxHash (which is a pretty neat blockchain service, check it out

+ This update to the last update fixes an issue with Widget animations that that update introduced. Whoops! Thanks for your patience. :)

----------

+ Nothing to see here... jk jk.

+ This update includes stability improvements as well

+ This update is mostly under-the-hood improvements to the app's overall perfomance.

+ Some of you may notice a new design and layout on the Discover tab that we're testing. Let us know what you think by tapping around!

+ New services includ

+ You can now export your IFTTT account data in a machine-readable format. Check out your account settings for more details.

+ To opt in or out of any of email communications such as alerts, recommendations, or promotions, visit your account settin

+ Introducing Rich Notifications: a new action in the Notifications service that allows you to customize the image and title of your notifications. Also, you can set a link URL that will be accessed if you open the notification.

+ When searching fo

+ We added a new field for the iOS Reminder's "Add reminder to list" action. You can now set a reminder's alarm date.

+ There used to be a banner that said "Uploading photos..." when your iOS Photos Applets sync. We removed it.

+ VoiceOver n

+ Siri now works with the Note widget service! Just say "Take a note with an Applet" to get started.

+ We made improvements to the location field editor, including auto-complete for location search.

+ If you use 1Password to sign in and to s

+ We fixed a last minute crash that affected some iPad users.

Here is the update we made earlier this week:

+ Siri now works with the Note widget service! Just say "Take a note with an Applet" to get started.

+ We made improvements to

+ We fixed another small bug! Pesky things.

Back to our normal programming, here is the update we made earlier this week:

+ Siri now works with the Note widget service! Just say "Take a note with an Applet" to get started.

+ We made i

+ We fixed a gnarly bug that sometimes required a 2nd button push to turn on Applets. Phew! Sorry about that.

+ New services include: MIYO, Trygve Connect, and Atmoph.

+ We added new help guides around the app where people tend to have questions. Look for a white "?" in a black circle!

+ Search now returns more relevant Applet results.

+ Welcome new services to IFTTT: Yalp, Hubitat, Turn Touch, and IntuiFa

+ We squashed some pesky bugs and fixed a crash some users were experiencing while using search

+ Welcome new services to IFTTT: Yalp, Hubitat, Turn Touch, and IntuiFace.

+ New and improved search! Get more relevant results for your Applet or service searches. Tap the magnifying glass in the top right of Discover to try it out.

+ We gave user profile pages a fresh look. Take a peek in your app settings.

+ Wel

+ We squashed a couple small bugs with the new search experience.

+ Fixed an issue that was causing some Applets to be oversized on iPad.

From this week's previous update:

+ New and improved search! Get more relevant results for your

+ You can now export your IFTTT account data in a machine-readable format. Check out your account settings for more details.

+ To opt in or out of any of email communications such as alerts, recommendations, or promotions, visit your account settin

+ We clarified a user survey and fixed an issue in Applet setup.

+ Recently added to IFTTT: Monzo Banking, Sengled Home, SAFE By HUB6, Q-See Plus, Air Quality by IQAir AirVisual, Reposit Power, Mysa Thermostat, Securmate.

+ We now support Dynamic Type, all text in the app will adapt based on your text size preferrence in Settings.

+ Recently added to IFTTT: ING Australia, iotty Smart Home, SSG Smart, and Hive View

+ We fixed an issue on the app's settings page.

New in 3.7.0

+ We now support Dynamic Type, all text in the app will adapt based on your text size preferrence in Settings.

+ Recently added to IFTTT: VeSync, M2M Services, MicroBot Sens

+ Introducing Applet feedback. Love a particular Applet? Have a suggestion to improve another? Now you can let the creators behind your favorite Applets know what you think.

+ For Applet creators out there: sign in to the IFTTT Platform to view the

+ We fixed some small issues related to Applet feedback. Now even better.

New in 3.7.2

+ Introducing Applet feedback. Love a particular Applet? Have a suggestion to improve another? Now you can let the creators behind your favorite Applets k

+ If your device is set to use a larger, accessible sized font, you will notice that we've made some improvements to accommodate. :)

From our last app update:

+ Introducing Applet feedback. Love a particular Applet? Have a suggestion to impr

+ Need help getting started? Updated onboarding flow helps you connect your first services
+ Location fixes
+ Improved deeplink support
+ Now discover rich, connected experiences directly in your favorite apps from Qapital, Welltory, and more!

+ Minor updates for improved user experience
+ Check out the latest services from Apilio and AQUAREA Smart Cloud
+ Check out classic services from Dropbox, Evernote, Instagram, Twitter, and Weather Underground.

+ We simplified the DIY Applet card so it's even easier to create connections tailored to your specific needs.
+ Easily discover and connect your favorite things with the new "connect" button directly on every service page.
+ We improved VoiceOver

+ We added support for home screen preferences in account settings. Now you can select "My Applets" or "My services" as your home screen view.
+ Easily view and mange your connected services with the new "My services" section located in settings.
+

+ We made it even easier for you to configure your Applets that use Weather Underground, Date & Time, Phone Call, SMS, Email Digest, and Email services.

+ Recently published services include: Notion, Connexoon, Tecan, Canon Inkjet Print, Longre

IFTTT is designed for a world where every thing works better together.

+ Connect more than 630 apps and devices to each other
+ The more services you connect, the more experiences you unlock
+ Applets are organized by the services you have c

+ We added links to Help Center articles so you can find answers to your questions without leaving the app.
+ Bug fixes to improve stability.
+ Recently published services include: Skyroam WiFi, Panasonic Home Navigation, BOCCO, Welltory, Automate

+ We fixed an issue that caused your Activity feed and My Applets to slow down.

+ Recently launched services on IFTTT include: Ai-Sync, Fanimation, Aquanta, Home + Control, and Mitsubishi Electric kumo cloud.

+ We also fixed an issue that caused your Activity feed to slowdown.

+ New services on IFTTT include: SONOS, Chatwork, Albert
